intro: Secamone bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white and yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
